job_title: talent programs and events specialist - singapore
location: marina bay financial centre, 8 marina boulevard 018981
responsibilities: company overview: google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. true, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. at google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. we provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. for more information, visit www.google.com/careers. the area: people operations great just isn't good enough for our people operations team (you probably know us better as "human resources"). made up of equal parts hr professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of google's colorful culture. in people ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to google and provide the programs that help them thrive. whether recruiting the next great googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. the role: talent programs and events specialist - singapore google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. the google people services (gps) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future googlers. as a programs specialist, you will enthusiastically represent the google brand and build our talent pipeline. whether it’s making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you will have an eye on the staffing needs of google and the broader hiring landscape. you'll be focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. additional role description: the talent programs and events team, part of gps, is focused on promoting google as an exceptional place to work for experienced talent, building a robust and diverse pipeline of outstanding candidates, and collaborating cross-functionally and globally to build and refine partnerships and outreach. whether you are developing events that will engage a target talent profile, building relationships with external organizations, or developing strategies to attract talent to google’s workforce, you will have an eye on google’s short- and long-term growth needs and a pulse of the broader brand landscape. you will partner with various staffing and product areas to build a comprehensive outreach strategy from the ground up and ensure perfect execution. responsibilities: - develop and execute events and programs for external candidates, track results and scale where possible. partner with internal entities to create comprehensive program and event strategies. - plan and execute recruiting and employment branding events, ranging from small intimate programs to large scale productions. - manage relationships with key external organizations and groups to cultivate a partnership and enhance google’s brand in the employment marketplace. - develop and implement events, including program mapping and planning, budgets, stakeholder buy-in, logistics, messaging, developing content with googlers, and other core elements to successfully meet event objectives. contribute to the online presence and public messaging by creating interesting and informational web and collateral content. - build relationships with vendors, internal team members, and a wide range of stakeholders across google to manage expectations and ensure high-quality event management.
requirements: minimum qualifications: - bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 5 years of experience in program/event planning, recruiting, marketing, hr, consulting or a related area. - ability to travel up to 50% of the time. preferred qualifications: - ability to focus on providing top-quality client support for the coordination and seamless delivery of events. - ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks, and follow through with team members to achieve group and individual goals. - willingness to roll up your sleeves and get the job done. - demonstrated project and budget management and organizational skills. - excellent relationship management skills, including negotiation, influencing, and interpersonal communications.

responsibilities: gq - nvmqra senior / engineer (rma) as a non-volatile memory quality & reliability assurance (nvmqra) engineer at the company, you will be responsible for performing formal failure analysis of customer reported failing devices via the returned material authorization (rma) process. you will be required to summarize lab analysis results at the electrical and physical level to identify root cause and establish an associated containment plan. in this role, you will have the opportunities to collaborate with various engineering and manufacturing stakeholders to evaluate and review corrective actions /preventive actions. you will provide documentation of the rma findings and oversee the final customer report till closure. in addition, for the senior role, you will be asked to provide guidance and lead the team when solving complex unplanned deviations reported by our customers. project management skills are necessary and the ability to make critical decisions that directly translate to quality and timely completion of the project is highly desirable. you will also be required to spearhead the sustaining efforts and keeping up to date on new product knowledge, as well as developing and mentoring new talents.   responsibilities and tasks perform failure analysis of customer returns  understand customer complaint of the memory component failure initiate communication with the company customer-facing team for further details on customer complaint, requesting additional questions to provide best opportunity for successful analysis perform bench level analysis including initial data image analysis/examination perform automated test equipment (ate) analysis and interpret results work with the appropriate engineering teams (e.g., pe, pye) to perform detailed fault isolation when electrical failure has been confirmed summarize findings and submit for physical failure analysis (pfa).  provide fa reports for the company customer facing team for communication to customers  summarize analysis at electrical and physical level into customer friendly formats. work with the appropriate manufacturing global quality teams through the appropriate request systems (example: gdms) for root cause and/or corrective action and a containment plan identify potential risk to external customers communicate with respective bu (business unit) on potential impact to customers communicate fa updates through interim reports or during scheduled meetings with the customers. provide formal fa report with findings    sustain knowledge of device capabilities and characteristics  keep up to date with latest wafer fabrication and package assembly process technology understand datasheet specifications for each device. comprehension of qualification data and potential impact to customer operation stay up-to-date on common customer system applications and usage model partnering with customer support team to resolve ongoing customer issues
requirements: qualifications and experience  excellent verbal and written communication skills. the ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing is critical in this role. good organization skills and ability to multitask and coordinate between multiple issue at any given time. ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and handle pressure situations in a professional manner excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with strong attention to details. familiarity with nextest /teradyne bench analytical tools, scripting in linux console will be an added advantage.      candidates with 2-3 years of experience in the semiconductor industry as product or qa engineer are preferred. relevant experienced candidates will be considered for the senior role.  education a bachelor or masters degree in electrical engineering or similar field of study.

responsibilities: gq - nvm qra engineer   job description as a nvm qra engineer in global quality, you will provide support for product qualification programs, assist with failure analysis and data analysis toward qualification of next-generation 3d nand memory devices. in this role, you will coordinate with multiple engineering teams to ensure appropriate product quality/reliability evaluation methods are developed and followed. you will be responsible for developing and overseeing outgoing monitor plans. you will perform risk assessments and provide product disposition for manufacturing teams dealing with quality and reliability issues. you will also be asked to gain new product knowledge, as well as develop and mentor new talent.   responsibilities and tasks   define qualification plans, manage qualification requirements, comprehend failures and rates within the scope of qualification, and perform risk assessments on all critical read points within the qualification plan. coordinate with other groups such as process development, product engineering, design, manufacturing and other engineering teams involved in the qualification process. provide release documentation upon achieving qualification and set up plans to monitor the quality and reliability of the products in the production phase. coordinate with research and development and product engineering teams to help comprehend new reliability issues and how to test for and assess their impact to customer risk and reliability. assist and consult on post qualification quality and reliability issues and assist in the analysis and disposition of these materials. perform product failure analysis on rejects.
requirements: skills and experience  rigorous use of statistical and analytical tools to help collect and resolve complex reliability and quality problems will be a fundamental aspect of this position. general knowledge of fab processing and device physics are required to be successful in this position. ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing is critical in this role. required to multitask and coordinate between multiple issues at any given time. candidates with at least 2 years of experience in the semiconductor industry as qa or product engineer are preferred.  fresh graduates are welcome to apply    education  a bachelor or masters degree in electrical engineering or similar field of study

responsibilities: job description:  manage full cycle recruiting for multiple, complex searches, creating innovative sourcing strategies and engagement to bring the best talent to each role. develop and execute fully comprehensive sourcing plans, analyzing requirements to determine target profile needs and matches. collaborate closely with hiring managers throughout the recruiting process to ensure we meet their hiring needs and goals establish and maintain meaningful relationships with management and key cross-functional stakeholders internally (e.g. hr, recruiting, legal and policy). leverage and maintain data reports and performance metrics to drive improvements as needed. coordinate closely with recruiting team members to innovate our research strategy for talent pooling, market mapping and competitor analysis.
requirements: job requirements:  minimum 5 years of full lifecycle recruiting experience. you believe in the power of communication and focus on building relationships long term. a passion for an amazing and seamless interview experience for both candidates and hiring teams. attention to detail. ability to multi-task and establish priorities. ability to maintain organization in a dynamic environment.  life at deliveroo we are a growing team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. we move fast, we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them. there are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. how do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? how can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? at deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. no solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous. benefits & diversity at deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. in 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. we did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. we believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success. we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. that means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are. all you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up's around.

responsibilities: as an assistant manager in the academic informatics office (aio), you will be assisting the nuhs value driven outcomes division on health informatics and data analytics projects to draw insights and facilitate sharing session with users. you are responsible in the following:  to engage users like clinicians to understand clinical indicators requirements, perform data analysis to monitor the indicators and visualize these data by tableau dashboard. plan, manage and implement health informatics and data analytics projects to draw insights and perform predictive and prescriptive analytics using r and orange theory. provide consultative support in visualizing, preparing and manage a variety of both internal and external clinical and operation data. with knowledge in health it data analytics, exposure to sql and other etl tools, you will be required to utilize these tools to process relevant data. ability to present information in clear and actionable manner with expertise in data analysis and organizational programs. collaborate effectively with diverse groups to provide advice for analytics related matters.

responsibilities: area soar (survey of antibiotic resistance) lead plays a critical role in the delivery of glaxosmithkline’s in vitro antibiotic surveillance studies providing an effective interface between the global soar lead, soar project manager and soar-loc leads.   - a vacancy exists within the area for a scientist/md who will be part of a multi-disciplinary team.  - the individual will work very closely with global soar-lead, loc-soar, leads and ppd/paraxel soar project manager. - the main focus is on ensuring high quality surveillance is performed in appropriate europe and emerging market countries to generate local antibiotic susceptibility data.  key responsibilities will include:  to work with global soar lead, soar project manager and soar-loc leads to generate high quality local susceptibility data against key pathogens. this will include lead to the design of antibiotic surveillance studies in an area, choice of appropriate sites and investigators, getting required local approvals to run the study, managing and supporting in-stream, cascading study results and troubleshooting   to work closely with soar-loc leads and soar project manager to get timely:  - abac/coi checks for each site and investigator  - fmv approvals for each microorganism  - finalizing contracts with investigators/study centers - ethics committee approvals  - sanctions and export control approvals for microorganism shipments to work closely with global soar-lead to get timely:  - abac/coi checks for each author  - data dissemination plans for each area  - approval of study reports in each country  - approval of manuscripts in each country   to work closely with global soar lead and area medical leads to proactively incorporate soar data into strategic co-creation plans.  to serve as an area microbiology expert and antibiotic resource for countries and maintain a high level of knowledge in the areas of microbiological science/technology and antibiotics (gsk and non-gsk, marketed and in development), and to provide internal/external training as appropriate.  to be an internal & external speaker to disseminate published soar data   to be accountable for all aspects of site management including ensuring completion and delivery of all local activities required to ensure high quality set up, execution and completion of studies to agreed timelines and budget  build effective long-term collaborative relationships, and to uphold the reputation of gsk.  to perform site evaluations and provide recommendations on site selection, study initiation, data collection, site close-out activities for assigned sites.   communicate progress and relevant study information or escalate issues of the study to the local study management team and other key stakeholders e.g. manager as appropriate.   accountable to acquire and maintain an optimal level of knowledge in all areas to effectively perform study activities (e.g. by holding investigators meeting)  this is a newly created 2 years contractual role under gsk.
requirements: degree in science/m.d (or equivalent) degree, preferably in a relevant scientific discipline.a broad understanding of clinical microbiology acquired in a clinical diagnostic and/or research laboratory setting  - high level of knowledge in the areas of microbiological science/technology, antibiotics and susceptibility testing methodologies especially clsi and eucast - strong communication skills and the proven ability to operate effectively in a matrix.  - ability to establish and build internal and external relationships at all levels.  - track-record of successful management and delivery of projects. preferred qualifications: - m.sc and/or ph.d. in clinical microbiology  - pharmaceutical industry experience preferred but not essential. - previous experience of generating high quality antibiotic surveillance data - experience of managing antibiotic surveillance studies, budgets, investigators and contractual arrangements

responsibilities: overview of job   mediacom is an agency of groupm, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of wpp. in fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. we are currently looking for a regional digital manager to join us. in this role, you will be working on one of our largest technology clients, dell and dell emc across strategic planning, media buying, and campaign management in a regional role with regionally executed campaigns and working with local markets across apac. the broad client product portfolio will provide you a solid experience in both b2b and b2c marketing. this is largely a digital role with exposure to both brand marketing and performance marketing rooted in leveraging the leading adtech partners. as a key player in the team, this role will work to continue our trusted partner status with clients and a strong internal collaborator with various specialist teams within mediacom at groupm apac, our people are our strength, which is why fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion is important to us. reporting of the role this role reports to: regional digital director  3 best things about the job:  working on the largest digital client in the agency means there is a lot of diversity in the role with a focus on innovation, testing and learning. this is particularly the case when it comes to data driven decision making, breadth and depth of ad tech exposure (ad server, viewability, brand safety, dmp, dsp, campaign management tools) and programmatic management. dedicated leadership team with a focus on team development and people management. as the largest client in the agency, there is constant access to the senior leadership team and best talent in the agency / industry. part of a high performing team who are passionate about the work we do and the client.  in this role, your goals will be: in three months:  an understanding of the client’s product portfolio, position in market and an insight into their key competitors. good understanding client campaign architecture and communication framework, regional and local managed campaigns, trading partners, tech and data suppliers and our ways of working with each partner. gain good knowledgeable about the campaign operations process from planning, execution to finance start managing existing digital campaigns met all of our key clients and started building relationships them.  in six months:  oversee day to day campaign and client management for existing campaigns with support from team members become a key contributor in strategy process of annual planning and media response to briefs started contributing to the wider digital department by championing our products and processes.  in 12 months:  become a trusted member of the team and gain trust of clients as the go to person for campaigns autonomously take the lead on managing digital planning and buying. contribute towards client innovation agenda and lead relationship with all relevant data and tech partners  what your day job looks like at mediacom:  proactively identify regional and local client needs. campaign planning, buying, implementation and reporting for the client’s digital campaigns. manage a number of different client stakeholders and product portfolios. support the director in guiding teams regionally. evaluate, recommend and implement different tech and data partners to improve efficiencies with buying and targeting. understand both the digital and financial marketplace to provide recommendations to the client on new trends and innovations. contribute to the wider digital department and agency, particularly with a focus on championing products and processes.  knowledge, skills and abilities  responsive – ability to jump in and respond to anything from big picture povs to supply tactical plans/ideas nimble – ability to be flexible and apply 80/20, has some self-driven hustle and sense of urgency embrace ambiguity – deciphers and distills questions and answers proactive service mentality with client & across network; and proactive communications innovation – revisiting/introducing new frameworks, principles, processes on a proactive basis thoughtful – possess a pov across marketing, media, marcom, creative, messaging, etc. business maturity – ability to sit across the table and be a strategic partner/trusted advisor to senior clients individual contributor – ability to deliver and high level of accountability follow through  more about mediacom mediacom is “the content + connections agency”, working on behalf of its clients to leverage their brands’ entire system of communications across paid, owned and earned channels. by focusing on the totality of our clients' communications, we deliver step-changing media effectiveness improvements, transforming our clients’ business through systems thinking. we employ 1800 people in 23 offices across 15 countries around asia pacific. our people are at the heart of everything we do; we firmly believe in our “people first, better results” philosophy and want to be certain that work is always challenging, engaging and satisfying. we aim to ensure that our employees’ skills are constantly evolving, and so provide all mediacom staff with training and development. we were named the best-performing media agency of 2017 (recma new biz balance 2017 report). in terms of new billings alone, mediacom topped the charts with over $1.6bn in new clients (recma new biz balance 2017 report). we are named the media agency network of the year by festival of media global awards (2018/2017), adweek (2017), campaign (2017) and m&m global (2017).  for more information, visit www.mediacom.com find us on twitter @mediacomglobal like us on facebook at facebook.com/mediacomglobalnews join us on linkedin at linkedin.com/company/mediacom about singapore groupm singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. being at the crossroads of asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners. as the largest media investment management company in singapore with over 41% market share (recma) and over 650 employees, groupm singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in.

best-in-class customer experience. currently circles beats all other telcos on metrics like nps, subscriber growth, average data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction.     our customers use ~3x the data compared to rest of the market. they are forever online and are digital natives. we are putting together a team that can use this treasure trove of data and develop the most complete understanding of customers that telco industry has ever seen. we have an opening for an associate product manager who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in singapore. do you want to get first hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate?   do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications? if the answer is yes, read on to find out more about the role at product strategy, competitive intelligence, and contribute to design/pricing of packages and plans in line with our highly differentiated positioning. your mission is to continuously understand the digital customer needs and come up with telco products that fit their needs and align with company plans and resources. you are as much at ease in an industry littered with jargon as you are with exploiting the power of analysis to communicate your views. in this position, your responsibilities will encompass the following:  develop strategy and roadmap for future products to fulfill user requirements. responsible for customer analysis, design to delivery (including quality assurance) of fully developed products that are ready for customer use prepare and deliver product presentations, product vision, and strategy design, develop and manage activities from product definition & planning to production and release provide timely and accurate information and status updates to key all aspects of the product development plan including pricing and positioning contribute ideas and recommendations toward product, process and system improvement understand data savvy customer expectations and industry best practices, including keeping abreast of the technology landscape perform in-depth opportunity/competitive analysis keep customer experience first, while developing ways to bolster customer acquisition, usage, and retention  what’s on offer circles.life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. in this role, you can expect:  unique to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups attractive experience and compensation working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment

all jjt resources, including project investment, jjt assets and labor resources. the individual will have the following responsibilities: project portfolio management  guiding the selection, reprioritization and optimization of the portfolio based on progress of programs/projects, technology obsolescence, and evolving organizational objectives. providing key stakeholders with timely assessment of projects pending selection, performance metrics and identification/recommendation to address portfolio issues affecting performance. ensures the completeness and accuracy of portfolio data with project managers and other stakeholders, including senior management. measure and monitor key performance indicators including portfolio value and project financials, including plan vs. and across the sectors.  continually strive to improve and evolve processes and develop organizational competencies in project planning and execution, resource management and benefit realization.  establish, execute and monitor resource management processes as needed. develop and deliver communication/change management and training in support of portfolio activities. measure and understand the total jjt financial health for scope of responsibility.  be able to articulate financial implications of current year portfolio on future year operating costs. • develop processes to be able to report on budget to actual spend of the portfolio. participate in cost reduction activities to as requested. drive total cost of ownership (tco) awareness of portfolio.  application portfolio management responsibilities: moving material makes the world’s work possible. caterpillar customers and their equipment are hard at work in every corner of the globe, and they can’t afford to slow down or stop. they need our machines, engines and parts to do the world’s work. that’s what our logistics team makes possible—using the latest digital, analytics and data forecasting tools to move material where it needs to be, when it needs to be there. want to join this process-driven, results-oriented group? the product support & logistics division currently has an opening for a supply chain planning engineer located at our singapore distribution centre.   working as a supply chain planning engineer for the facility health organisation on the cat logistics team, you are responsible for facility performance levels to corporate targets for inventory storage utilization, improving storage efficiency, improving facility operational results and managing capital improvement projects. you will lead facility efforts to implement process improvements and standard compliance where realised benefits are evident.  job duties/responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:  working independently as well as working effectively with diverse, multi-functional teams gathering and analysing data on facility demand and demand variability gathering and analysing data about inbound and outbound functions throughout the facility managing the facility rearrangement plan and rearrangement team to complete planned rearrangement activities, including capacity and productivity goals completing capital purchasing functions for the facility, including procurement, installation and place-into-service maintain facility product slotting rules to align with inventory profile changes over time look for continuous improvement opportunities throughout the entire facility and make expert recommendations for process changes to improve results lead and/or participate on cross-functional teams targeting facility improvements collaborate with engineers globally to benchmark best practices and implement improvements working with wms to optimise setup for local business conditions
requirements: basic qualifications and eligibility:  bachelor degree qualified or possess the relevant work experience thorough experience in one of the following functional areas: supply chain, manufacturing / operations, manufacturing engineering, inventory management, 6 sigma/cat production system experience with warehouse operations and warehouse management systems (wms) prior experience with ms office & data analysis   top candidates will also possess:  bachelor level degree, preferably in mechanical or industrial engineering or business previous experience in logistics planning & engineering or as a supply chain planning analyst or supply chain engineer understanding of industrial engineering principles strong problem solving, analytical, priority setting and communication skills sap ewm warehouse management experience prior experience using autocad

responsibilities: about the company circles.life is world’s first and most successful digital telco. we have a mission: to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer through our customer centric mobile platform and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar global telco industry. we launched our services in singapore in 2016 and have since gained market share quickly while delivering best-in-class customer experience. currently circles beats all other telcos on metrics like nps, subscriber growth, average data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction.    our customers use ~3x the data compared to rest of the market. they are forever online and are digital natives. we are putting together a team that can use this treasure trove of data and develop the most complete understanding of customers that telco industry has ever seen. we have an opening for a senior qa automation engineer who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in singapore. do you want to get first hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate?   do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications? if the answer is yes, read on to find out more about the role at circles.life! job description: circles.life is looking for a senior qa automation engineer who possess superior analytical skills, energy, drive and attention to details. do you want to continually make code quality go up and raise the bar for everybody! do you believe in and enforce test driven development, get to define testing strategies, and get a kick out of uncovering those hard-to-find bugs.if you are upto the challenge then this is for you. as a key member of our team, your responsibilities include:  must understand the automated testing framework, tools, and automated test suites. if can build and design then its a plus. enhance and maintain automation frameworks for scalability, stability, and performance. execute multiple iterations of the test plan by running manual and automated test cases. interact and collaborate with product team to identify and understand testing requirements.  what’s on offer circles.life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. in this role, you can expect:  unique opportunity to be a part of the digital disruption in telecommunication (circles.life is the only company of its kind in all of asia!) autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups attractive experience and compensation working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment
requirements: requirements  candidates must have 3+ year of experience in automation scripting. (selenium with java or experience in developing test automation in any other language like c++, ruby or python etc.) must understand the automation framework, plugins and external tools. familiar with sdlc/stlc or agile process. must have good expertise on manual testing. familiar with bug tracking managing tools. must be able to write test cases and good with breaking the codes. experience in a product-basesd company is advantageous

responsibilities: team: enterprise services operations team location: singapore   microsoft services mission is to lead and serve our customers and partners as they realize their full potential in a mobile-first, cloud-first world. we are a diverse group of technical architects, engineers, consultants and support professionals, more than 21,000 strong, serving customers in 191 countries and 46 languages. we drive over $5b in revenue annually.    services continues to be the key differentiator in accelerating a customer transformation ensuring they get the most out of their technology investments. in order to support microsoft’s transformation, we must continue to evolve what we sell, how we sell, how we deliver, how we operate, and how we drive consumption for the company.   enterprise services (es) worldwide delivery organization focused on global domain delivery. this new delivery model was designed to better align delivery resources and support end-to-end offerings for our customers. global domains are aligned by technology and include a broad set of global expertise to create an agile delivery team that supports the customer lifecycle from pre-sales, to implementation, to proactive services.    responsibilities     the es operations team which is part planning and business excellence organization has a mandate to partner with domain and account aligned delivery leadership to achieve operational excellence. as a part of this endeavor we have an opening for a seasoned planning & insights leader to partner with the enterprise services leaders.  deliver robust annual/ quarterly delivery planning (demand and capacity plans) for both consulting and premier business by providing key insights / inputs from areas / time zones to central planning & domain facing planning team and vice versa. collaborate with diverse set of stakeholders in areas, multi-sub areas, subsidiaries on delivery planning syndicate with finance and gcm counterparts and ensure an integrated plan is built between areas and domains on demand and capacity for es business support clarity across area and domains on planning inputs/outputs and connected processes / racis provide leadership in enabling the below challenges to represent before appropriate forums / decision makers for resolution and circle back to the respective stakeholders     accuracy and feasibility of domain & area interlock capacity distribution across multi sub area & sales locations area specific capacity around language, pub-sec, security cleared balance area needs and specifics with affordability and all up plan monitor and revise area /sub level resource and ppg mix sold margin vs. delivery margin at area level respond and clarify area concerns on demand & capacity drive premier one plan process in areas provide insights from areas on pneh, burn rate, service mix, technology mix relating to premier delivery area presales planning & maintenance area pivot for cfo forecasting support monthly & adhoc capacity analytics requirements (tz, area & sales location) level deliver capacity insights for area xbus     provide forward looking business visibility based on advanced statistical analytics, predictive models and deep insights (scenario modelling, trend analysis, correlations/ knowledge discovery, machine learning, statistical forecasting, early warning system etc.). ability to handle large, complex and disparate data sets; build models ground up, interpret the story behind the numbers and syndicate the output with broader set of stakeholders. identify trends and inconsistencies in data to provide perspective and business solutions. present data-driven analyses to solve complex business problems. provide analytics and insights to the business leaders to have consequential business review rhythms (qbr/ mbr) by closely monitoring the key performance indicators, critical success factors, scorecard metric, cost and productivity levers, sales motion, leading/ lagging indicators, red pockets, root cause analyses, recovery plans, investments/ rois. enable the business leaders on governance, control and compliance aspects.  key success criteria and competencies required   future orientation balanced with current state through strategic and systems thinking and a global mindset influencing stakeholders to achieve impact through collaboration, presence and strong communication skills judgment based scoping of problems by identifying key issues, inputs, stakeholders, and outcomes. applies a broad functional knowledge base to solve problems with confidence and persuades others dealing with ambiguity change management analytical problem solving​

delivery etc., and should be self-motivated, confident in working with senior leaders and comfortable working in a matrix organization. the candidate need to be able to achieve results through influence across multiple organizations.    bachelors in business, information technology, finance , operations or related field, and/or equivalent experience proven stakeholder management skills, especially in a cross organizational matrixed teams a strong business aptitude coupled with an affinity or appreciation for technology and the advancement of technology in thriving organizations ability to effectively prioritize and coordinate multiple work streams of activities knowledge and understanding of the financial and operational functions of a delivery organization (i.e., budget, time logging, optimizing cost, escalation processes, invoicing, capacity management) ability to develop strong, productive relationships with colleagues and management to meet targeted objectives an analytical mindset with the ability define metrics, reports, interpret results, and make recommendations on appropriate courses of action excellent communication, collaboration, organizational, time management, presentation, and writing skills proactive, self-motivated, and team-oriented with strong capabilities to lead and thrive in start-up type organizations​    microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual responsibilities: job title: sap pp - mm senior consultant job description: this is for candidate who has both specialize sap knowledge on production planning and material management. candidate must have implementation experience and be able to work as an individual contributor during the implementation period. responsibilities:  you will be part of full project lifecycle experience including design, data, functional specs, configuration, testing and post go live support experience assess and recommend solutions according to scope and to resolve open design issues configuration of pp to support scope; document configuration rationale develop functional specs for all relevant developments to support pp processes integrate with sap mm develop / update relevant master data standards especially master data to support pp processes integrate with sap mm update existing business process flows (solman) and business process design documents for their process areas as required confirm security roles for implementation with security team confirm risks and controls for implementation by the grc team design metrics and reports to support operational and management reporting for pp-mm; write reporting functional specs prepare integration test scripts complete unit testing, integration testing and support user acceptance testing

responsibilities: reporting to the manager of the basic design, stability, mooring and weight control department, the incumbent will be assigned to stability & mooring or weight control team. stability & mooring team is responsible to support the analysis, design and testing of stability & mooring for new offshore structures and vessels through exploration, sourcing and development of new range of stability and mooring control methods and systems to suit the operating needs in a different environment. weight control team is responsible to prepares key project documentation (i.e.weight control procedures, weight reducing proposals and loading condition, and etc.) for weight design in bid packages, equipment data sheets and contract specifications. responsibilities:  prepares key project documentation, including structural design brief as specified in bid packages, equipment data sheets and contract specifications to develop trim, stability and loading manual and etc. for project execution prepares rough sketches, drawings, general arrangement, capacity and lines plans and other engineering data on stability & mooring by utilising engineering common network, software and tools prepares hull form, geometry plan, tank plan, hydrostatic and tank sounding table, (i.e. based on motion analysis, risers analysis and air gap analysis) to determine volume and positioning in centre of gravity in inclining test prepares and optimises vessel specific test procedures and calculations for vessel stability & mooring in lightweight survey and load line (i.e.longitudinal strength, intact stability and damage stability conditions) performs studies to explore and design new optimal lightweight offshore structures and vessels, focusing on their operating requirements and weight optimisation under the supervision of senior team members prepares weight forecasts and investigations, emphasising on weight information to determine the selection of materials (mtos) and equipments as weight saving alternatives during the design phase participates in weight assessment audit to determine the preliminary weight inputs (i.e.unit weight budget) provided by the engineering disciplines comply with the defined budget weight under the supervision of senior team members prepares weight calculations and centre of gravity (cog) to identify trends and areas for optimisation, including monitoring weight changes to alert management on the exceeded lightship design weight for further solutions coordinates with other engineering team members (i.e.structural/ general design/ stability&mooring/weight control), subcontractors and consultants on technical issues and design solutions
requirements: bachelor’s degree in  naval architecture/ structural engineering/ or related engineering disciplines 5 years of  relevant experience in stability & mooring/ weight control and basic design in oil and gas  projects advanced user of microsoft office products, autocad, staad, and adobe acrobat possess working knowledge or fundamentals in naval architecture, hydrodynamic, and engineering principles knowledge of engineering analysis techniques and tools/software applications used in naval architectural engineering  knowledge in the studies and optimisation of hull form using cfd techniques coupled with model testing for the purpose of minimising resistance or improvement of sea-keeping performance    our address sembcorp marine ltd tanjong kling yard 29 tanjong kling road singapore 628054 tuas boulevard yard 80 tuas south boulevard singapore 637051 mon-thu : 7.30am – 5.15pm fri : 7.30am – 4.15pm interested candidates with relevant background are invited to send us an updated resume with your current and expected salary, reason of application and earliest availability to kenneth.cheng@sembmarine.com. please ensure that the position title or reference code (if available) is clearly stated in your subject line. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. please note that your personal data disclosed to sembcorp marine ltd and our group of companies, shall be used for the purposes of evaluation, and processing in accordance with our recruitment processes and policies. by providing your personal data, you have consented to the aforesaid purpose under the provisions of the personal data protection act 2012.

responsibilities: tower research capital seeks a senior software developer to join the core engineering team who is excited to design in-house trading systems that are robust, resilient, and extremely fast. these systems enable tower to execute algorithmic trading strategies based on patterns in market behavior. by building and maintaining this high-performance infrastructure, tower’s developers have helped to position the firm as a leader in the field of quantitative trading. this role is available at our singapore or shanghai office. responsibilities the software developer will be responsible for:  designing and implementing a high-frequency trading platform, which includes collecting quotes and trades from and disseminating orders to exchanges around the world optimizing this platform by using network and systems programming, as well as other advanced techniques to minimize latency developing systems that provide easy access to historical market data and trading simulations creating tools to analyze data for patterns building risk-management and performance-tracking tools    benefits  competitive salary free breakfast, lunch, and snacks on a daily basis gym membership five weeks of paid vacation per year plus public holidays  for employees ineligible to participate in the cpf, the cash equivalent of the employer’s cpf contribution

responsibilities: about the role  this is a 6 months rolling contract the incumbent will be deputed to work at a banking institution  job summary: the test manager is responsible for managing the day-to-day activities of a software test team comprised of test analysts. the person is will be responsible for the test case design, coordination, preparation and execution. he/she is expected to deliver high-quality test results in a timely manner by creating and implementing testing strategy, producing test plans, assisting with test case design and development as needed, driving execution of manual and automated testing, monitoring test status, and providing mentorship to team members. the role exercises independent judgment to clarify tasks, set clear project milestones, deliverables, and provides leadership to the team. this role will work directly with development, product analysts, vendor teams, application support, and will interact directly with end users during uat phase. roles and responsibilities:  contribute to the planning and implementation of a quality assurance framework for the software testing lifecycle of the bank participate in the requirement analysis and identify gaps in requirement by assessing the product functionality, usability and fitness for purpose work with project managers, development and engineering teams to ensure efficiency of system integration test cycles and propose improvements required if defects are found. this includes the technical support of all testing cycles (system integration testing, user acceptance testing) for both responsibilities: johnson & johnson technology (jjt), technology services (ts), has an open position for portfolio & program manager (ppm). the role is to support johnson & johnson technology (jjt), infrastructure and applications services in defining and delivering aspac portfolio of projects, working in alignment and collaboration with the global portfolio. the ppm is responsible to establish, monitor and manage the portfolio for ts aspac region.  a robust portfolio & program management process is critical for enabling key decisions on where to focus both time and resources inorder to ensure that ts continues to deliver value to johnson & johnson and the businesses that we support.     the individual will have the following responsibilities: portfolio management  guiding the selection, prioritization and balancing of the portfolio based on business and jjt strategic objectives and financial/resource constraints.   continuous review of the portfolio and recommending reallocation, reprioritization and optimization of the portfolio based on progress of programs/projects, technology obsolescence, and evolving organizational objectives. providing key stakeholders with timely assessment of projects pending selection, performance metrics and identification/recommendation to address portfolio issues affecting performance. ensures the completeness and accuracy of portfolio data with project managers and other stakeholders, including senior management. measure and monitor key performance indicators including portfolio value and project financials, including plan vs. committed vs. actuals and driving benefit realization.  support leadership level decision processes by providing timely communication to stakeholders on progress, changes and portfolio impacts. drive/facilitate the portfolio governance processes and reviews, inclusive of business planning processes.   provide input to and participate in key program/project reviews, including documenting executive summaries. provide education and support for the portfolio related data and processes. collaborate with peers to develop and execute portfolio and capacity planning processes within ts and across the sectors.  continually strive to improve and evolve processes and develop organizational competencies in project planning and execution, resource management and benefit realization.  establish, execute and monitor resource management processes as needed. develop and deliver communication/change management and training in support of portfolio activities. measure and understand the total jjt financial health for scope of responsibility.  be able to articulate financial implications of current year portfolio on future year operating costs. develop processes to be able to report on budget to actual spend of the portfolio. participate in cost reduction activities to as requested. drive total cost of ownership (tco) awareness of portfolio.    program management  work closely with all stakeholders to understand the business requirements, developing effective working relationships and on-going management processes for the delivery of the programs with the ts portfolio.  work with the project managers, to help estimate and plan projects from start to finish, with built in contingencies, aligning to the other project plans.  resource management planning and allocation of program managers and support the process of project prioritization, approval and initiation, including supplier selection if appropriate.  mentor project managers and ensure external contractors working on projects understand project life cycle and qa requirements.  work closely with other members of the ts leadership team to deliver organization objectives and ensure the business benefits and return on investment are realized.  structure and daily-manage the pmo, looking to continuously improve and implement best practice. produce, maintain and manage the roadmap of projects deliverables, over a rolling 12-month period.  overall accountability for the budget management, monitoring expenditure and costs against delivered and realized benefits as the roadmap progresses provide a quality assurance role ensuring that projects are well managed and adhering to appropriate standards and good practice.  facilitate and manage portfolio issues and risks through to appropriate resolution, change management and budgetary control identify and implement new and more efficient ways of working and promote best practices   ts leadership team (slt) operations & communications  organize and plan aspac ts lt meetings and events (such as monthly/quarterly review session, business planning activities etc.).  build agendas with input from the leadership team, organize presentation materials and coordinate presenters. manage enterprise ts reporting requirements for strategic investments to senior leaders mature ts communications of accomplishments highlighting business value drive organization headcount processes ensuring transparency of vacancies and managing attrition to achieve management decisions serve as focal point to finance organization to achieve financial objectives.

performance management. passion to learn and make a difference.  the candidate has high levels of self-assurance and shows resilience and belief in own ability to achieve goals. the individual will need to be a relationship builder and able to get things done independently. must have a high level of integrity supported by strong interpersonal skills, good maturity and ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization will be critical to the success of this role.  lastly being part of the ui family, the candidate must be able to thrive in a fast paced and highly dynamic environment and navigate through complexities to arrive at solutions. he/she is expected to demonstrate the following leadership behaviors:  strategic, systemic thinking & entrepreneurial high growth mind-set & consumer/shopper and customer focus ul sols: building talent and teams, bias for action and change, accountability and responsibility  strong communication & influencing skills  critical competencies  working knowledge of sap or other similar accounting software systems experience dealing with multiple currencies and exchange rates preferred strong analytical and writing skills advanced knowledge of microsoft office software ability to build effective working relationships and communicate at all levels within the organization    to apply:  please apply online by clicking on “apply online” below. your application will be reviewed against our requirements. should you not meet our immediate requirements, your profile will be registered in our talent pool system and we will match your profile to suitable future vacancies.  you will be able to access your status update through the candidate tracking link.  thank you for your interest and application.  *we regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. want to join our talent community? please register your details here: http://unilever.avature.net/madebyyou?tags=singtc

job_title: management assistant officer, scale (programme and student administration)
responsibilities: job purpose  the school of continuing and lifelong education (scale) was established to drive the expansion of nus’ continuing education and training (cet) offerings in a concerted and strategic way that furthers our mission to be a leading global university, as well as fulfill our role as a public university of singapore.  scale aims to:  provide opportunities for working adults to acquire new knowledge and skills from a distinguished university; help singapore companies and industries stay competitive by providing lifelong learning experiences for their employees; and effectively support national manpower needs.  drawing on unparalleled access to the multi-disciplinary expertise of 16 other nus faculties/schools, scale offers executive and professional development/training programmes, part-time degree programmes, as well as modular courses that may be taken singly or stacked towards certificates/diplomas/degrees that meet the lifelong learning needs of working adults.  all programmes are designed and developed in consultation with the industry to ensure relevance and currency. to augment the manpower in our academic programme support unit, we are looking for a diligent and meticulous individual to fill the position of a management assistant officer. reporting to the head (programme/student administration), the incumbent is a member of the team that strives to provide our teaching staff and students with high quality administrative support to facilitate a seamless and efficient experience at scale. duties & responsibilities: a. programme support   prepare data for module registration in each semester and assist in students’ registration   collate semestral nomination of teaching/support personnel to run all academic programmes   manage the scheduling and grouping of tutorial and laboratory sessions   manage/monitor students’ registration, progress and completion of the final year project module   monitor students’ graduation or programme completion status   assist in conducting  programme surveys and provide data preparation support in the student feedback system   arrange for students who are academically at risk to attend advisory sessions with academic staff   process students’ requests for examination review   provide support to ensure the smooth execution of examinations    b. customer care support    attend to telephone, walk-in and email enquiries   c. others    backup other colleagues in the function   perform other duties, and/or participate in regular and ad-hoc events/projects, as may be assigned
requirements: requirements:   polytechnic diploma/gce a-level or equivalent preferred   preferably 1-2 years of related working experience   it savvy and proficient in ms office applications   good verbal & written communication and interpersonal skills with a positive work attitude   excellent coordination and organization skills, with a customer service mindset   strong team player who is meticulous, resourceful, resilient and thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented and ambiguous work environment   experience in peoplesoft campus solutions modules (in particular, campus community, student records, student financials, campus self-service, academic advisement) an added advantage

responsibilities: position: marketing / brand executive (pharma / fmcg background) location: central working hours: 5 days / 9am-6pm salary: up to $4000 + aws duration: perm  main responsibilities:  support the marketing manager in the development of the national & regional brand marketing plans work with the multifunctional team to implement the plan in the market place and monitor performance of the support plans. support the brand marketing plan development and deployment. generate and execute marketing campaigns across social media platforms generate reports for digital marketing campaigns using data-based analytics tools and also presenting this data in an easy to understand format assist in the brand’s day to day operational activities including monitoring of brand performance on a monthly and quarterly basis. source advertising opportunities and place adverts in the press, radio or tv as appropriate to the product or service conduct market research and analyze consumer rating reports/ questionnaires design and oversee ad layouts, bundle pack labels or designs liaise with media, printers and publishers as required and manage the production of marketing materials work with btl vendors for effective and efficient deployment in close coordination with sales team and regulatory. manage the nuts and bolts of commerce business – translations/ providing images/ deciding on promotions and managing mechanics. prepare and deliver promotional presentations, sales force training write marketing literature (brochures, press releases) to augment the company’s presence in the market be the single point source for all customer complaints.
requirements: requirements:  min degree in marketing, business management, sales or equivalent min 2 years’ working experience in pharma sales or related field possess good knowledge of market research techniques and databases have good understanding of office management and marketing principles  in order to speed up the short listing process, qualified or interested candidates are strongly encouraged to submit your updated resume in ms format to celine@searchpersonnel.com.sg to find out about other career opportunities in search personnel pte ltd, do visit www.searchpersonnel.com.sg / www.facebook.com/search.personnel for complete job listings. ***we do not charge our candidates any referral fee. *** celine tan executive consultant reg no.: r1873694 | ea no: 13c6684

job_title: digital api & agile transformation consultants - senior associate / manager, advisory
responsibilities: we are a team of creative and inspiring designers, developers, and strategic thinkers that partner with our deep analytics team, customer journey design team to focus on the business and employee experience implications of digital-first for our clients.   about the opportunity digital api & agile transformation consultants at ey digital are the engine room of our business, working on the front lines with our client, colleagues and third-parties to execute the digital business vision. we work across industries and markets, cross-pollinating the best of digital, customer, strategy and technology to help our clients monetize data and design new services through api solutions, and help execute digital transformation through large scale agile methodologies and modern agile development platforms. and at the heart of it all, embed customer centric experience design in how we execute. digital api & agile transformation consultants embrace an achievement focused culture within ey, living ey’s core values, and positively influencing our culture more widely through the collaborative engagement of other internal teams to deliver leading practice digital strategy, innovation, customer experiences and digital operations.   key responsibilities:  feel excited working with multiple parts of the businesses across multiple industries, solutioning and delivering complex digital solutions you find yourself always wanting to innovate and shape the industry, wanting to differentiate you have been known to be able to understand both sides of a coin, the business aspect and the technology aspect of things you believe that design thinking and is the way to go in everything that we do, and agile methodologies can be applied appropriately in how we execute
requirements: skills and attributes for success  you always see yourself as someone who likes being near the businesses and is always passionate about looking for opportunities in turning day to day business challenges into digital solutions you enjoy communicating with people from various background and skill sets across an organisation, and has always been great at communicating an idea or pov across various channels and mediums    to qualify for the role, you must have:  minimum of three years' experience as an internal or external consultant working on business transformation, product, operations and/or technology projects in a digital environment experience of multi-channel digital environments having worked in professional services and/or customer focused companies skilled in all aspects of design thinking including user research, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, business modelling, and workshop design and facilitation, or working knowledge of the full lifecycle of software development using agile methodologies either strong business analysis experience or deep technical expertise combined with strong knowledge of one or more of digital/ecommerce/government/financial services/consumer products detailed knowledge of creating user stories/requirements definition/acceptance criteria using agile tools and techniques deep understanding of either api, low code development platform, chatbots or crm b2b and b2c exposure      ideally, you’ll also have  excellent communication and stakeholder management skills ability to work in a collaborative and client-facing environment experience of working with or as part of a scrum team advanced degrees relevant to digital delivery.    what we look for highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. an effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   what working at ey offers  ey offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. we are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. plus, we offer:    support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career the freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you      about ey as a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. this starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. so that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional ey experience lasts a lifetime.   if you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   join us in building a better working world. apply now.

job_title: project buyer (west, erp, sap / r3, up to $4.4k)
responsibilities: a well-established us manufacturing mnc.  responsibilities:​  responsible for the disposition of material according given demand in cip’s (continuous improvement project) andcsr's (customer specific requirement), achieving lowest possible cost with shortest possible lead time, otd (on time delivery) and up to our quality standards. implement 6r of the logistics -» right material, right price, right quality, right time, right place, right conditions.  key responsibilities: cip & csr  disposing and ordering material for cip's and csr's according to demand in the erp system (sap). work closely with local production planning. work with the supplier to agree on corrective actions to resolve escalated issues (e.g. chasing supplier for otd) or look for alternative suppliers when necessary. request and analyze quotations. negotiate prices based on open calculation, lead-time, landed cost and total cost. issuing po’s (purchase orders) related to quotations.  npi’s  support npi (new product introduction), dapi (da product innovation) and lli (long lead item). issuing qc’s (quantity contracts) and call offs related to qc's or po's  (purchase orders) related to quotations. work closely with global strategic supply management (support of supplier evaluation, phasing in new products, and in managing of demand request for project-material orders) and operational purchasing in asia (malaysia and china).  generic  hand over engineering change requests to suppliers (close team work with manufacturing engineering). prepare analysis and statistics to control and support the sourcing strategy and the strategic planning. proactive improvement of the quality along the entire supply chain in close cooperation with all involved departments (product group, research & development, material management, and finance). control and verify invoices with price deviations referring to po. make sure that all necessary purchasing parameters (vendor data, contracts) are given and stored properly and take appropriate actions whenever necessary. improvement programs correspondingly. monitor the supplier performance, conduct regular supplier assessments and audits, and prepare analysis.​
requirements: requirements:  degree in mechanical engineering. 5 years' experience in global sourcing (asia focused, asian supply market knowledge). experience in supplier qualifications, auditing and corrective action processes. experience in sap/r3. excellent negotiation skills. experience in execution of total daily business of material purchasing, establishment of timely availability of all orderedmaterials and services and optimization of material flow and of inventory level. able to optimize the supplier relationship by combining supplier's and internal processes. good understanding of the supply chain, the critical production and assembly processes.  other information:  working location: science park. working hours: mondays to fridays, 8.30am to 5.30pm.  to apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com and search for job reference: 13860. to learn more about this opportunity, please contact novita tan at novita.adisutanto@gmprecruit.com we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. gmp recruitment services (s) pte ltd | ea license: 09c3051 | ea personnel: novita tan | registration no: r1220374

job_category: healthcare / pharmaceutical, information technology, sciences / laboratory / r&d
responsibilities: looking to work with other driven programmers, engineers and designers on ground breaking medical technology? skin cancer diagnosis is currently a slow, expensive and none-too-accurate process. here at iko, we have been working hard on our patent-pending imaging technology and are developing our platform to increase early cancer detection and save lives. we’re now looking for world-class talent to join our development team. iko is a small, singapore based startup with clinical trials taking place in some of the most prestigious facilities in the world. our office is in a beautiful modern shophouse, accompanied by a variety of other startups under one umbrella company. enjoy the closeness of a small startup team, with the vibrancy of a communal environment. as part of a small close-knit team, you’ll be working directly on core product development and will have direct impact on the success of our venture. the ideal candidate will be a highly motivated developer to take charge of the development of our embedded device application software, running on the nvidia jetson tx2 som. the role includes implementing the necessary algorithms for real-time data processing, user feedback and device control. we offer:  a supportive, informal environment of other experienced programmers, engineers and designers. complex and meaningful work, with the opportunity to see for yourself how clinicians, patients and healthcare systems stand to benefit. good monthly salary; performance-based annual bonus.
requirements: qualifications in computer science, software engineering or equivalent experience. highly proficient in c++. highly proficient in parallel computing with cuda. experience developing on the nvidia tegra based soc / som (nvidia jetson) highly advantageous. knowledge and experience in computer vision and 3d graphics highly advantageous. initiative and a strong sense of personal responsibility. tenacity to solve hard and interesting problems. able to work both independently and collaboratively. strong troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving skills.

responsibilities: the role we are seeking engineering professionals who will lead exciting projects in the design and implementation of decentralised water, wastewater and environmental management solutions. you will apply your ingenuity and engineering skills to solve real world problems in an innovative and fast-moving environment. some of the immediate assignments you may take on include:  perform site visits, field observations and data collection; design water and wastewater treatment systems using our range of water smart blue building technologies for customers in singapore and the region; manage the implementation of such water and wastewater treatment projects; develop innovative proposals to address water and environmental in collaboration with our network of international technical experts; supervise operations and maintenance of treatment systems to ensure optimal performance

company: national university health system pte. ltd.
responsibilities: you will be responsible for supporting the group centre of excellence in leading and managing costing and pricing process across nuhs.    he/she will be expected to:  interpret policies and guidelines from ministry of health (moh) and work closely with the institutions to implement the policies. review the current costing/pricing process and the dependencies of each respective institution and develop overall costing/pricing policies, guidelines and parameters harmonize and align a set of costing methodology and a systematic approach of collating costing data within the cluster. develop a group policy on costing of services and an alternative costing model eg: abc costing. review the service categories and current pricing policy and align where possible to adopt a standard policy within the cluster. run benchmark exercise across cluster. work on the costing algorithms to determine the rebase costs across the respective institutions. follow up on the findings from the costing process study and propose recommendation/approach to streamline costing methodology within the cluster and at the same time aligning to ncg guideline. organize regular meeting with institutions on sharing of issues, processes and workflows and adopting best practices across the cluster. attend related internal and external costing and pricing meetings eg: cosys, bt and update the institutions. provide regular updates to the gcfo and institution cfos on the progress of costing & pricing. identify and implement continuous productivity improvement opportunities through process efficiencies or automation.
requirements: you should possess a degree in accountancy, finance, business and a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in finance or audit. applicants with more than 6 years of relevant experience may be considered for manager position. acute business acumen and understanding of organization issues and challenges. experience in developing new costing/pricing methodologies and guidelines and lead in the change process is preferred. ability to analyze different types of data and data evaluation metrics. ability to work independently and as a team with minimal supervision, incredibly organized and execution focused. excellent interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written. proficient in sap and ms office applications (advance) such as words, excel and powerpoint.

responsibilities: the successful candidate will oversee the analytical function across a variety of brands. the incumbent will be responsible for providing periodic reports, analysis and support other departments through data/report automation. this position is part of the corporate team, reporting to the board of directors. the successful candidate will report directly to ceo of the company.   responsibilities  in charge of the analysis team (with 1 or 2 more professionals) to provide timely reporting on the performance of the company. review performance of existing businesses and highlight areas of underperformance. do financial projections and assessments of potential projects to evaluate expected returns and feasibility. calculate product costing and develop suggested pricing for local and overseas markets. determine the optimal markup of products and royalties for the company and potential franchisees. provide information on impact of new products, marketing campaigns and promotions develop and manage incentive programs for operations staff. conduct ad hoc studies of overseas market to understand the local operating cost. provide ad hoc support to other departments in the form of report automation and performance tracking automation. manage the point of sales (pos) backend system for singapore.
